meanings.definition: Plural noun: Righteous individuals in Jewish tradition.
meanings.sent1: The zaddikim were respected for their good deeds.
meanings.sent2: The community looked up to the zaddikim for guidance.
meanings.sent3: The zaddikim always seemed to have a smile on their faces.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the zaddikim were portrayed as beacons of light in a dark world.
meanings.sent5: The legacy of the zaddikim lived on for generations.

meanings.definition: Plural noun: A group of righteous people.
meanings.sent1: The zaddikim gathered every week to discuss important matters.
meanings.sent2: The zaddikim worked together to help those in need.
meanings.sent3: At the party, the zaddikim were the life of the event.
meanings.sent4: The zaddikim stood out in the crowd like shining stars.
meanings.sent5: The bond between the zaddikim was unbreakable.

meanings.definition: Plural noun: Those who are considered holy and just in Jewish belief.
meanings.sent1: The zaddikim were known for their unwavering faith.
meanings.sent2: People sought the blessings of the zaddikim in times of trouble.
meanings.sent3: The zaddikim's presence brought a sense of peace to the room.
meanings.sent4: The zaddikim were like guardian angels watching over the community.
meanings.sent5: The stories of the zaddikim inspired many to lead better lives.
